episode_summary: This episode covers a variety of intriguing topics, including historical blame on camels in Abyssinia, the ancient Greek use of yo-yos, the mobile lifestyle of honey bees in the USA, and the frequent calls to police from people lost in a large corn maze.

facts.fact: If you got into an argument in 18th century Abyssinia, you could resolve it by blaming everything on the camel.
In ancient Greece, they used to play with yo-yos.
Most honey bee hives in the USA live on trucks, on flatbed trucks.
The Sacramento Police Department get at least one call a week from people stuck in the world's largest corn maze.
